Reviews.Title: “A small Gem”
Reviews.Author: twoeyeswild
Reviews.Content: The GEM in Chelsa is a very nice hotel with rooms that are small if you have a single queen bed. The location is fanastic, close to the Highline Park and walking distance to Chelsa Market. Quite street location is very nice. The room had a small wardrobe that one door would hit the air conditioner so you could not open it all the way. The bathroom sink is very small with little room to set down any toiletry items. The staff were very cordial and helpful. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Even better on the second trip!”
Reviews.Author: SeaTravelTime
Reviews.Content: Had another great stay at the GEM hotel in Chelsea. Well appointed and efficient clean room with a great bathroom! Staff was always friendly and assisted with everything. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Gay-Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jim L
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife due to the cheap rate. However, in the first room they gave us, there were several stains on the bed, hairs, and signs of poor housekeeping. Also, now I see in the NY Times that management markets this hotel to the gay community through gay travel outlets and makes extra effort to attract gays given it's location near gay bars, a porn shop, etc. In the future I would shell out a few extra bucks for a cleaner, more family-friendly place.

Reviews.Title: “A good average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Russco2000
Reviews.Content: Its true that the price of this hotel makes it very attractive. For that reason I chose it for a recent business trip and it was indeed perfectly located for my needs. The hotel has a wonderful New York charm about it which initially endeared me to the place, but after a few days the charm wore off. The room was small but by no means was that a concern for me, it had everything I needed so it worked out great. I had a great room with a view, positioned right on the corner of w22nd Street and 8th Avenue on the fourth floor. The only problem is that in the 'city that never sleeps' with that room it meant that you will never sleep too. Fire engines, police cars, crowds of people, street sweepers, all going throughout the night right passed your head. The bathroom was great, again, wonderful new york charm and had everything I needed. The only 'complaint' I have was that the room was always cold. It was like the walls and windows were there just for display rather than function. I'd imagine that would be great but I was there during some particularly chilly nights. The heater was adequate however, its just a shame the room was so cold. The hotel is perfectly positioned in Chelsea, and with no breakfast on offer you have the most amazing bagel bakery right across the block to indulge in. Overall nothing really wrong with the place and I would probably tell people about it, along with my views of the 'charm'. A good average hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: YourNextGuest
Reviews.Content: The room was ridiculously small, but it IS NYC. It was a great location, and the people were nice and knowledgeable of the area. I'll try another GEM hotel before I go back to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vinicius R
Reviews.Content: The Gem Hotel Chelsea, always be my first choice, when i go to New York. The hotel is execellent, because the hotel was in a great location with lots of good restaurants , bars and delis nearby. The neighbourhood are not very touristc area, and it's great to seems maybe for a few days a local. The room are smal, but if you are in New York, you problaby walk all day long, and doesnÂ´t matter the size of the room. the only thing i didn't like is the mattress, not so good, can be like these one with memory foam mattress. The rooftop deck was very, very cool. The shower was great and always when i come back to the room the cleanness was perfect. The staff are very helpfull. So i love this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Csdemaio
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean rooms right in the middle of Chelsea. Great location. Rooms were typical size for NYC, everything was clean and free wifi was a plus. Great place to stay

Reviews.Title: “It is very likely I would recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: jevedebe
Reviews.Content: Everything about this charming hotel was good. No real negative comments. Only if you need a big room no need to come here. There's also no breakfast, but plenty of opportunities in the neighbourhood. If you don't like the idea of being in the middle of the LGBT Chelsea-district in an hotel that really supports the community you don't have to book. The WIFI i my room was weak and the coffeepads in the room could also be stonger and tastier. I dicovered the hotel in the Flemish newspaper De Standaard beginning of Jan 2012. Good recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable!”
Reviews.Author: ASayre
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gem Hotel and, truly, it was a gem! The staff were very congenial and helpful. It is clean, quiet and well priced. A quick walk gets you to any number of great restaurants. I really hate to share this fantastic spot but if I don't, they may leave. So, when staying for fun or business, they have earned my allegiance as they will earn yours if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great price in a good location!”
Reviews.Author: chickytava
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at the Gem Hotel's Chelsea location on a Saturday night in January 2012. I was incredibly surprised that my mom got the room for only $159/night, which is unbelievably reasonable for the location. The hotel is located on 22nd and 8th Streets, more or less in the middle of Chelsea. It's within walking distance to the train station, and two different subway lines are within 1-2 blocks. However, it's a little bit of a walk (5-10 mins) to any good restaurants or shops in Chelsea (which I personally find a lot less exciting than Tribeca/Soho/Greenwich). But if you don't mind the exercise or hopping on a subway, it won't phase you. The room was small, but we didn't care because we weren't in NY to sit around in the hotel. It was clean, modern, and tastefully decorated in a black/white theme. Our window looked out onto another building's windows, but again, we weren't there for the hotel view. A huge bonus is that it was quiet -- extremely quiet at night, and the bed was comfortable. The front desk service was also excellent. The only minus (and the only reason it gets 4 stars instead of 5) is that I found two stranger's hairs in the bathroom upon first getting to the room. Otherwise the bathroom was spotlessly clean, but I'm a stickler about hair (yuck). Overall, for value (I mean, $159 in the middle of Manhattan!?!) this place can't be beat, and I would both recommend it and stay there again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Michael R
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the GEM. The staff were friendly and accommodating and the cleaners were amazing. Further, business centre was accessible with no additional printing costs. Finally, the GEM was exceptionally gay friendly. We will definitely stay at the GEM again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service & Honesty!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MzMary
Reviews.Content: I have been to this the GEM twice and both times i was even more impressed. The rooms are small but the furnishings are very simple, clean and smart that you don't even mind the size. I cannot say enough about the customer service here as they are so far the best that I have encountered here in NY. It is in an area where you don't have to go looking for anything since everything is right around the corner. My room was always very spotless and the view on top of the roof is soooo beautiful at night...I have never been to a hotel in NY that actually made me feel comfortable or had such warm customer service. The exceed all expectations and everyone that ask me about hotels in NY I only refer the GEM. I should also add that on one of my trips for work that as I was leaving the hotel and in a rush to get to work but was also checked out, I remembered as I was walking into the building at work that I forgot my ring on the night stand. I frantically called the hotel hoping someone would find my ring and actually give it back, the front desk clerk JEFFERY told me he would personally go up to my room and check and call me back in 15 mins. That was the longest 15 mins but he said he found it and would hold it there for me. I knew I would not be able to get it since my fight back home would be right after I got off of work and I could not miss the flight. I enlisted one of my friends to pick it up for me but he could not pick up that day. The very next day I was already back in CA and I got another call from JEFFERY from the hotel. He was concerned since he got back to work and my rings were still there. I told him that my friend would in later that evening to pick them up for me. I was most definitely grateful for his honesty and still am since those were my wedding rings...WHEW!!!!...Like I said, Excellent Service & Honesty...You can't go wrong with both items...I recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone...:)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: Aus_Gary
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this property. Check-in was excellent, the clerk that assisted us was very helpful, with check-in and suggestions for the neighborhood. It's a quick walk to the subway station and the neighborhood has many good places to eat. The rooms are small but comfortable, bathroom was very functional with a good shower. Our room was very quiet, it was on the 5th floor in the center, so did not face an active street, though the only view was the windows of the other rooms. I would stay here again as well as fell very comfortable in recommending the property to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, but wear earplugs”
Reviews.Author: suitcaseinhandBoston
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed in a double room. As others have noted, the rooms are very small, but I was impressed with how efficiently the space is used to make it a comfortable space for two (not petite) people. The staff was friendly, the bed was comfortable, and the outside noise was minimal because our room faced a wall of another building. We could, however, hear every word and sound made by guests in the hallway. Overall, given the very reasonable rate and good location, the Chelsea Gem is a great value, but next time, I will bring earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, Fantastic location, Fantastic Service!”
Reviews.Author: jenslish
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Thanksgiving weekend while in NYC alone. WHAT A GEM of a hotel!!! Not only is the location wonderful and close to the metro, but the neighborhood is quiet and safe. There's a small market across the street and plenty of little places to eat in the area. The hotel staff made my stay incredible. So kind, friendly and helpful! Every time I entered the lobby they made conversation and just made me feel welcome. The hotel is pleasantly decorated and they have stones with the hotel name stamped in it as their cards. Fun! The rooms are small, but what room in this price point in NYC isn't small? I felt perfectly comfortable in my room and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again on my next trip with my husband. The desk area may be small if you need to sprawl out and work, but it was perfect for eating a sandwich or using my laptop. The bed was comfortable and the water pressure was nice. Check out the Upright Citizen's Brigade just a few blocks away for some incredible improv comedy! Oh, and FREE WI-FI!!!!! Overall, this is my new favorite hotel and I can't wait to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, dirty rooms and hallways.”
Reviews.Author: sjboyden
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great corner of Chelsea with a fab cafe across the street and friendly locals. The hotel itself is furnished in ikea esque materials. Very nice bathrooms, but the rooms look dirty. And we stayed when the place was almost new.

Reviews.Title: “Quality location and price!”
Reviews.Author: rtbutler
Reviews.Content: Great - small rooms - love this location. Overall quality is fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, expensive for what it is.”
Reviews.Author: Traveltink
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location with lots of good restaurants and bars nearby. Felt a bit more like an authentic neighbourhood and not very touristy for a true New York experience. The room we had was tiny, quite cold and the air con/ heater noisy when turned on. Some of the front desk staff were not very helpful, I asked on two separate occasions for recommendations for a restaurant (breakfast and dinner) and was recommended to the same place twice. I went there on my first day for breakfast as I didn't know any better but there are lots of amazing places close by that I event to over the 5 days I was there. Compared to other hotels we have stayed in across the world, this felt very expensive for what it was, although it's a peak time and so guess this affected the price.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: flyingfrank82
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with an amazing staff! Yes the rooms are small...YOU ARE IN NEW YORK! What do you expect? You should only be sleeping in there anyway. The location is so good you will not want to go back to your room. But when you do, you will be greeted with smiles and a clean nice room.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay, wonderful neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: keithb789
Reviews.Content: My favorite thing about this hotel was the neighborhood - - there were so many great eating and shopping opportunities nearby. I walked to the West Village a lot, which was a very pleasant stroll. And right around the corner from the hotel was a subway stop to take me wherever I wanted to go. There is construction happening on the ground floor retail space, and it was noisy. When I first arrived I had a room on the second floor, and it was incredibly loud, the drilling and banging. But they allowed me to move to the fourth floor. I could still hear noise travelling up to my room occasionally, but it was not very bothersome. The room was not large but it was definitely not the smallest room I've had in Manhattan. I liked the modern design of the room. The shower was great. Pillows were comfortable. The HD flat-screen TV was nice. Two minor complaints: one was the fact that I had an "interior" room that faced a wall. A lot of the rooms at this hotel are like that. But, at least I had no complaints about street noise. My other complaint is the noise of the doors. The room/stairwell doors are metal and they make this clicking noise so any time someone comes or goes, or uses the stairwell, or housekeeping opens/closes rooms to clean, you hear them. It seemed like there was a lot of door noise at all times of the day, which drove me crazy a little bit when trying to sleep in or nap. The rooftop deck was very, very cool. Great view toward the Empire State Building. No one was ever up there so I felt I had it to myself. I liked it and found it relaxing. Staff was mostly nice. The hotel's location was perfect. The price was reasonable. I would stay again, especially if I could guarantee a room that didn't look at a wall, and if I were to find a good rate. Be sure to eat at Lucky Burger around the corner on 23rd - - it was tasty! Also, it was nice to have a Whole Foods for snacks and prepared foods a few blocks away on 7th Avenue near 24th Street.

Reviews.Title: “What a GEM”
Reviews.Author: crofty49
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the GEM over thanksgiving and what a GEM it was. When we arrived a nice young man called Geoffrey checked us in and was very helpfull.Yes the rooms were small BUT you are in New York how long do you spend in your room??? The bedding and towels were clean, There was a hairdryer, shampoo, and shower gel also bottle water and coffee maker. All the staff we met where helpfull. The metro only a block away and the area was safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Value”
Reviews.Author: carrollkvn
Reviews.Content: We decided to spend Thanksgiving Weekend in NYC. Having been to the city many of times for both work and fun I have realistic expectations for the size of hotel rooms. The Gem had a good rate and we booked at least six months ahead. The location in Chelsea was good for us because we had friends in the neighborhood. The hotel is a block from the A and C trains as well as the cross town buses. We arrived on the red eye so go to the hotel at 7:00 am. It was sold out the night before so we could not get into a room right away. The hotel gave us the first room that was cleaned and we got in to our room by 11:00. Not too bad. Room was clean and designed well with a safe and small ironing board in the room. We had a queen room #302. It looks out onto a wall which normally I wouldn't love but it also was very quiite with no street noise. Hallways are nice and clean and there is a huge roof top deck to enjoy. Without exception the staff were friendly and helpful. Only complaints were the bed was way too soft and the door to the room is not very well insulated, conversations in the hall sound like they are in the room. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: LiaX
Reviews.Content: Having been in NYC several times before, we wanted to stay in this more residential area this time. It was a good decision (Hotel Mate Grace and Ink49 were great also). The hotel is located on a corner with 8th avenue, so subway, taxis, busses - everything is nearby. And lots of fabulous eating/drinking options. Red Cat and Drunken Horse just a short stroll away, the Co nearby, a nice (longer) walk to Madison Square Garden and Shake Shack... And for the joggers: up the Highline and down the Hudson makes for a healthy morning start. There's a roof terrace which for sure is a great place for a last drink on a warmer evening (although you'd have to ignore the "no alcohol"-sign ;-) The rooms are small as is the wardrobe. You have to figure out where to place your suitcases and then there's little room left to move. There's a big flat screen TV, an electric kettle with tea and coffee. The mattress is very comfortable. The bathroom is well maintained, very clean and up to the expected standard. We had no bathtub only a shower, which was fine with us. It worked perfectly: water temperature, pressure, perfectly clean shower curtain, no flooding, shampoo and shower gel dispensators, hairdryer. Could also do with a little bit more space to put things on. Bring the kind of toilet bag you can hang. The staff is friendly and helped out with information we needed. New York is not the place you go to spend much time in a hotel room. For us, the great location more than compensated for the smallish rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tlabranche
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel a few times each year for work. I go out of my way to book the propery for a few reasons. First is the location. It's located right on the E line on the subway and it's very easy to get around the city. You are only a 15 minute walk from Times Square. Second is the service. I have been staying here for three years for work. I have yet to experience a rude staff member. Finally is the value. The few times I paid my own personal funds for a room, I found the value to be very good considering you're in manhattan. Yes, the rooms are small. But you shouldn't be headed to the city to live in your hotel. That is just my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay, away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: Melanie716
Reviews.Content: Very glad we stayed here. The hotel was in a great location. The rooms were clean and modern. Yes, they were small but that didn't bother us at all. We spent the day sight seeing, and this hotel was a nice place to come back to at night.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, a bit noisy - but decent”
Reviews.Author: J0nners
Reviews.Content: Decent enough, but room was very small and also hard on 21st & 8th I think so lots of road noise at night. The bathroom was pretty nice, with an excellent shower. As for the area, it was close to my office so convenient for me. However, the vicinity of the hotel is nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Great Overall Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: CalH87
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel that I have stayed in NYC so far. The location was great, and the rooms were new and clean. There was a business centre that we could use free of charge, as well as free Wifi which was great. The staff are very friendly and were always willing to help us out with whatever questions we had. It was only 100m to the closest Subway stop, and was within walking distance of 2 other lines as well. Plus there was lots of great restuarnts to choose from that were also within walking distance, and a great Bagel shop that we went to breakfast for most mornings. The rooms were small, but that is standard for NYC. The bathroom was decent sized but and the shower was great. We hardly heard any street noise from the room that we were in, which guaranteed a great nights sleep. The pillows were the extremely soft kind which was a pain for me, but if that it the only complain then this hotel is definitely doing something right!! Can't wait to stay there when I return and check out the new restaurant that they are adding!!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: WilliamN78
Reviews.Content: The rooms are VERY small. Just about ok for one, but would have been a squeeze with 2. But well appointed, and comfortable. Staff also excellent. The roof terrace is fab but shame there are no drinks allowed up there. The other main minus with my room is that it had almost no natural light and was incredibly dark. The bathroom fan was also incredibly noisy as was the aircon. I think it would probably be impossible to sleep with the aircon on, which may be a problem in the summer. There's no breakfast available. However the location is great, minutes from the metro and lots of nice restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Small, actually tiny, but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: michelle_koh
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel -- five-star location, three-star room and facilities, at a three-star price (managed to get a discounted rate by booking early on Expedia). The rooms are very tight -- just enough room for the bed and a tiny wardrobe. The bathroom only had a shower, not a bath (which suits me fine). The room was otherwise comfortable -- clean, air conditioning worked, quiet, Wi-Fi which worked, computer printing facilities, ice machine in the basement, friendly staff. Clean, no-frills accommodation, at a reasonable price. What really sells this hotel is its location -- a short walk to Chelsea Market and the High LIne, SoHo a stone's throw away, subway station on its doorstep. I travelled on my own and felt really safe, will be happy yo stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny space, horrible bed, good location”
Reviews.Author: EmeraldCityJunkie
Reviews.Content: Pros: close to subways and restaurants. Cons: over priced, small, horrible bed, linen and pillows, no tub/shower only. Poor cost to value/quality. The only good thing about this place is it's location. It is surrounded by restaurants and subways are close by. The rooms at the Gem are not just small, they are tiny. The bed all but filled the room. In the corner was a free standing "closet" reminiscent of something one might use in a garage, and was not large enough to store my suitcase inside. There was not even enough space to accomodate my suitcase next to the bed, so I was forced to place my suitcase on the bed to open it. The "closet" did include the 2 things I rarely use, a safe and an iron. The bed itself was far from comfortable. The mattress sagged and the linens were horrible. Ever seen a sweater ball up? The sheets at the Gem Hotel were rough, with balls of fabric that scratched at exposed skin. It was much like what sleeping on velcro might feel like! The pillows were equally awful, fiber filled flat lumps. The bathroom would have been adequate if there were a few hooks to hang towels or a shelf to place a glass, contact solution, or toothpaste. There wasn't even a toilet tank to place so much as a cotton ball upon! No tub, a shower only, which is fine, this is not marketed as a luxury hotel, but the shower curtain was too short and water dripped outside onto the floor. One thing I did like was the shampoo and body wash dispensers on the shower wall, which avoids waste and plastic bottles being tossed in a landfill. The air conditioning worked, but the 2 foot square vent blasted air and sounded like a jet engine. Good luck sleeping with that turning off and on. So if you are looking for creature comforts go elsewhere. Men may do better in these rooms than women. If you are fine in small spaces and don't mind an over priced room in exchange for a location near subways and eateries then you are golden. For my money, the price was exorbitant if you look at cost to quality. This is listed as a 3 star hotel, don't believe it. It felt like a luxury hostel instead of a hotel. I can understand a slightly higher room rate due to three events during my stay: US Open, 9/11 Memorial, and Fashion Week. Even so, the room rate was not worth these accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Good Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GGG2006
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel probably seven or eight times for work and it provides exactly what I need. A clean room in a convenient location with a reasonable room rate that won't eat up all of my travel budget for the year. You need to be prepared that the rooms are very small, like many New York Hotels. And if you are staying in the least expensive rooms, the beds are only doubles so very small. With that said, the rooms are always very clean, the staff is very friendly, and there are small desks for working. There isn't any room service but its New York so many places nearby deliver and there are many restaurants in walking distance both sit down, take out and fast food. Free wifi is always a bonus as it annoys me when hotels charge a daily rate for it. No counter space though for your toiletries in the bathroom. Overall nice hotel - no bells or whistles though. Im sure ill be back many times.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and wind blown!”
Reviews.Author: more2gofr
Reviews.Content: OK.. this is NYC. Everything is expensive. But the price/quality didn't hold up. The AC in the room (Month of June) was way too noisy. Everytime it kicked in, we woke up. It literally made the ceiling tiles move and vibrate. Otherwise, the place was clean, and service was good. Windows could have been better adaped to mute the street noise.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: pero_brown
Reviews.Content: in the heart of trendy chelsea, only a block away from a subway station, the gem is a small and charming hotel. the rooms are small, but comfortable. good shower and cozy bed. the staff is nice and helpful. and the location is really really good!

Reviews.Title: “Just What We Needed”
Reviews.Author: StarfishandSeashells
Reviews.Content: We booked through Choice Hotels, because we have a points membership for our hometown hotel. We booked only because of TA reviews. So we knew the rooms were incredibly small. Everything was as expected. Nice decor. Tiny rooms. We booked two rooms and put one adult and one child in each. The bathrooms were updated with quality materials, but very small with limited vanity space. The shower curtain didn't reach quite far enough down, but it wasn't a big issue. There was no bathroom fan. The beds were comfortable enough. Good pilows. The TV was flat screen. There was an iPod dock in the room and a small desk with stool. There was no closet, but there was a cabinet (think dorm room) with a table top ironing board and iron, extra toilet paper, etc). There was also a hair dryer hanging in a bag in the bathroom. A floor length mirror was a plus. The coffee maker was not easily visible, but it's there (bottom of night stand). Also, a much appreciated bottle of water was left in our rooms each day. The hallways were small, but noise could potentially be a problem is there were noisy neighbors. We had no issues (except hearing our own family members). The doors are very noisy when shut. However, there was no street noise, only an occasional distant rumbling of the subway that runs underneath. The thing to remember about space and noise in NYC is that you will most likely be exhausted and it won't matter as long as you can shower and sleep. The front desk staff were always friendly. We prepaid, so were surprised that $80 room charges were taken from our debit cards in case we damaged anything. However, these charges were removed before we returned home. Upon our early morning arrival, they stored our luggage in a locked room until check-in. The location for us was great! It's located on the corner of a tree-lined street of brownstones. Also a beautiful church is across the street. Hailing a cab on 8th was never a problem and the subway was one block away. One night we walked from Times Square. The only place we ate nearby was a little store around the corner (b/w 22nd & 23rd) where we just happened to hear a local order, "A BLT and quick!" or we wouldn't have known hot food was available - A great breakfast and late night snack. We bought drinks and coffee there each day (the creamer is located in the bottom of the cooler).

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: diekudus
Reviews.Content: The staff is fantastic, rooms are fantastic, they are accommodating, professional and overall superb. Thank you for a memorable time !

Reviews.Title: “Love the hotel, but beware of theft”
Reviews.Author: patroclus_dc
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Chelsea Gem on numerous occasions. It's a cozy hotel, with small, yet functional rooms. The staff is friendly, by NYC standards. My only complaint is the theft that occurred in my room. My Baume and Mercier watch, which I accidently left behind, managed to vanish. The head of security refused to return my calls, which resulted in me sending a native New Yorker to their door. The security officer also refused to see him, until my friend refused to leave until he did. Amazingly, he appeared and denied all responsibility. The theft was shameful, obvious, and blatant. I expected more from Ascend. Beware, don't use their safes and keep your valuables at home.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice Experience w/ a Couple of Exceptions”
Reviews.Author: ny2ecity
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Gem Hotel was overall positive. The front desk staff was awesome and very helpful, especially Jessie. He made my husband and I feel comfortable and recommended some great eateries in the area. I prepared myself prior to the trip about the size of the room. Yes it is small but my husband and I made due. Otherwise my only gripe with the hotel is how the hotel handled someone in the hotel smoking, which set off the fire alarm 3 times during my stay. There should have been some type of security to handle this situation because it happened throughout the night. Otherwise, nice hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: jgoto
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the beginning of July. The price was great, the location was perfect for us - very central for walking and 1 block from the subway. The staff were helpful and friendly. The room was clean and modern and very quiet at night so no problem sleeping - it was very very small, but the washroom was an adequate size and all we needed it for was sleeping, so we were very happy with it. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite place in the City.”
Reviews.Author: MBiblis
Reviews.Content: This charming boutique hotel made me feel as though I was staying somewhere in Europe. The room was small but comfortable with beautiful modern decor, and clean efficient bathrooms. The value, we paid between $120-175 a night, was outstanding, making it our new favorite place to stay. Our only disappointment was the fact that the shower curtain in our bathroom was hung an inch too high allowing the water from our shower to puddle in the rest of the bathroom. It's an easy fix.

Reviews.Title: “Postcard Rooms but good service”
Reviews.Author: mathTeach314
Reviews.Content: Pros: service, location, free wifi, roof-top balcony, good decor Cons: room size, no one told us about the roof balcony so we found it by accident our last night, bathroom sink pretty but not very functional street noise

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.. Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cubincave
Reviews.Content: PROS: 1) Location Location Location. Easy walking to almost everything in Chelsea or the West Village. Many subway stops near by. 2) Lots of night life 3) Lots of food options 4) Near the subway stop at 28th and 8th Ave 5) Room was chic and modern 6) Business area and fitness room. 7) Free Wifi 8) Friendly staff. CONS 1) SMALL size rooms. 2) Street noise on 8th Ave rooms 3) No sign to tell maid not to disturb OVERALL: The hotel is in a great location. Easy walking to subway stops ( 3 near by ). Although it is located at 8th Ave and W22, Walking back to 6Ave is not a very long walk at all. A downside is the size of the room. If you have a couple of BIG bags... and there are 2 people.. it can get VERY tight quickly. On the bright side, you are in NYC and there is NO reason you should be in your hotel room other than to sleep. My only real complaint was there didnt seem to be a badge to let the maid not to enter the room in the morning. would definitely stay again..

Reviews.Title: “Great location with helpful front desk”
Reviews.Author: ldknurse60
Reviews.Content: We visited NYC recently, and stayed at the GEM Chelsea. The first time I entered the room, I was a bit stunned to see it was smaller than a European hotel where we'd stayed. The beds are queen sized, no king . But, by the end of the trip we found the size of the room mattered very little, because we spent little time in it. I saw NO bed bug evidence whatsoever. My nightstand had a dirty area, covered up by what turned out to be a broken clock radio. I left a small note, and the maid service took care of the problem promptly. Our room was very quiet, and on the 2nd floor. The front desk people were always friendly and helpful. Free wifi worked perfectly. We would stay here again! I miss Murray's Bagels (across the street and down a few doors) already! For those first timers to Manhattan...please make sure you have cash with you, as many restaurants do not take credit/debit cards. Take comfortable shoes, because you will walk a lot. I mean a lot. Subways are really fantastic as a way to get around town, and the city is laid out very nicely. It's a great place to visit, and you will never be bored!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Friendly with an Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: richs52
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the GEM Chelsea this past weekend for a solo getaway to NYC. From check-in to check-out everything was excellent at this hotel. My room, while small, was well appointed and clean. The free water and coffee in the rooms is a nice touch. The free wi-fi was fast and dependable. I liked the fact that you could open your windows to let fresh air in, and that the window sheilded street noise when closed. The neighborhood is excellent with many places to shop and eat right outside your door. Very easy subway access as well. I usually stay in the Mid-town/Times Square area when I go to the city, but not anymore. The GEM Chelsea will now be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, will stay again”
Reviews.Author: american11
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife took a vacation to east coast. stayed at this hotel for 4 days. very remote locatoin, and clean rooms. the elevator was out of order, but it dint bother us. we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: dzordzdzordz
Reviews.Content: We spnet 5 days in this hotel. Hotel has really small rooms and when I say small i mean SMALL! But on the other hand price for night is excellent in Manhattan. We used this hotel only for sleeping and spent all the time exploring city. If you are looking for hotel just for sleeping in good location, take this one.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, broken facilites, disappointing”
Reviews.Author: karnaff
Reviews.Content: The first thing you notice when you enter the room at the GEM hotel is its size. Tiny. Even in NYC standards. Then you start checking the room and find some more - the sink in the bathroom was cracked (room 509), the desk thing was tiny and broken, the ventilation system was noisy. And when you go out of the room to go out, the elevator is out-of-service... The good points - friendly stuff and the location

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, underspaced”
Reviews.Author: DanaRot
Reviews.Content: This was our first - and last - time at the Chelsea GEM hotel. Since we were travelling with friends we let them do the booking and so all we learned about the hotel came from its website that seemed pretty impressive. Oh, how wrong we were. First, the good thing - location is excellent. Right in the heart of Chelsea, with convenient Subway access. The hotel presents itself as a boutique hotel. In my book this means premium price for premium comfort, service and design. Not so much so in this case. Although the hotel is very nicely designed, someone forgot convenience and comfort in the process. The design does not compensate for the fact that the rooms are extremely tiny even by NYC standards. Tiny as in a 6X6 ft room, with a queen bed smack in the middle. Imagine trying to get around the room at the same time with your husband or getting dressed after a shower. Not doable. Since space is so limited, the closet that is in the room is also tiny and could not accommodate more than our jackets. Needless to say, our clothes remained in our suitcase for the duration of the stay - less than ideal, and the suitcase took much of what was left of the room... Bathroom space was also limited, as there was no real shelf for putting our stuff (toothbrushes included) anywhere but on top of the sink. Other problematic issues - cleanness. Bathroom was not clean, and we've had to ask for it to be cleaned again. Even so, we've long noticed hairs in the shower stall (since both me and my husband have short cropped hair, this couldn't be ours...). Yuck. For the most part of our stay the elevator was malfunctioning, with one day in which it didn't work at all. Though we had to schlep through the stairs to the fifth floor, no compensation or even apology was offered. While we are very undemanding (want a clean room and comfy bed. All the rest are negotiable) and will willingly accept that kind of performance from a cheap or lower-rated hotel (as we did, in the past), the huge difference between the way the GEM hotel presents itself and performs is a reason not to return there. There are much better (and cheaper) options in this area, including the Hampton Inn and the Garden Inn in Chelsea (which we've tried in the past and enjoyed), that I see no reason to return to the GEM.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay. Wonderful Location.”
Reviews.Author: cyranotony
Reviews.Content: Private and surprisingly not too loud off an Avenue. - For a REAL New York stay away from the hustle and bustle of Time Square. Right down the street from the Subway.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: ucblu3
Reviews.Content: great desk staff, like family, very helpful with everything! very clean, comfortable and close enough to where you want to be. could not have picked a better place to stay for what we wanted to do,[eat,shop,what ever]. desk clerks- debra,jen and keith gave info, for everything we wanted to do or go and helped with the directions. ask them about parking, the best place,[quik park] right down the street and very reasonable, paul the attendent, the best!!! and if you need to get a hair cut , mario nico down the street, super,fabulous job!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “READ THE FINE PRINTS!”
Reviews.Author: dalllo
Reviews.Content: Just spend a long week-end in New-York at the GEM - It's a very nice well located hotel- rooms are on the small side but once you know about it (it's our third stay) you pack accordingly. After I got back, I noticed a small additionnal $8 charge to my credit card that nobody had metionned. I called and and they told me that this was for the safe in the room! $2 per day even if you didn't use it, and that I should read the prints when checking in ! because they mentionned it. Now I realize it's not the first time they do that. It's a stupid charge, never seen that before elsewhere, that is just leaving me with a bad after taste. I told them they should mention this charge to their clients, but they replied I should read !! the prints. The hell with you guys. I have other choice of nice located hotel to go to in New-york city. Respect your clients!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: SpringfieldUS
Reviews.Content: Located in a surprisingly quiet street, still close to Central Manhattan this hotel is an excellent base for exploring the big apple. Walking to Times Square takes less than 30 minutes. Room was small, but the standard not too bad (bathroom a little cold in December though). Staff was friendly and offered useful information about restaurants and nearby sights, and room was cleaned every day + tidied up in the evenings. We missed a breakfast room or a coffee shop within the hotel, but there was much to choose from within a five minute radius. Recommended for a laid-back stay in NY, but would choose something different for the big occasions.

Reviews.Title: “a GEM and a dream...”
Reviews.Author: shazziedoll
Reviews.Content: i loved this hotel....the decor, and the staff, including desk manager keith made me feel like a queen!!! check in was a breeze and marcello was so accommodating at the same. the location was perfect for a downtown girl like myself..i will never stay anywhere else when in the city...two short subway stops and you are on W4th...perfect for a night out...i felt pampered and tres special..thank you keith and team for making me feel like a superstar...muah...

Reviews.Title: “The Gem of Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: sleepinnpcb
Reviews.Content: My partner and I arrived at the Gem on Monday Dec. 13th for four nights. This was our first vacation to NYC. When we arrived, we could not get over how quaint the location is, right at the end of a row of beautiful brownstones. The lobby was set of a beautiful boutique hotel. The staff, all of them were very accomodating and friendly. They always asked how our day was when we came in in the evening. The rooms are small, but I understand thats NYC. Very very clean, and had everything we needed as we werent in the room but to sleep. We will be back this summer and will be at the Gem. Thank you so much for everything. We love ya!

Reviews.Title: “Charmless hotel & staff. Shabby exterior.”
Reviews.Author: camieLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night as I arrived in NY quite late on my own (but had a more centrally located hotel for the rest of the weekend booked). From the website the photos looked great and i expected a large hotel like reception. The entrance was on the side road and the adjacent windows to the front of the hotel looked like they were under renovations but had stopped. In fact from the entrance I thought I was entering a small motel. There was nothing in reception, no bar, no option to order room service late at night - I was offered a vending machine by the charmless receptionist. There was no bar and no breakfast so basically it was just a hotel with rooms! Must admit the room (queen size) was spotless although absolutely tiny - fine for me on my own but wouldn't recommend for two. The decor in the room was lovely, comfortable bed, large TV and very very quite. Location was very quiet. I expected Chelsea to be a more happening area - I might not have done my homework well but it seemed to be just a nice residential area rather than somewhere to base yourself for shopping. There are plenty of other hotels that offer more and are more centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - excellent location”
Reviews.Author: A&L
Reviews.Content: Well located in the heart of Chelsea, the Gem is a nicely presented small hotel. Rooms are pocket sized but well equipped, with nice contemporary decor. We had some difficulty getting a fork - but entirely minor complaint. We will definitely stay here again next time we are NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Very tiny room, but very clean and in a nice neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: sharmayacht
Reviews.Content: This hotel has very small rooms (we are talking 9 ft x 8 ft with normal size bathroom) but they are clean, which is my #1. I am sure they are average size for NYC. On a very quiet street in Chelsea, walking distance (3 blocks) to subway or short cab ride to many destinations. Neighborhood has many good restaurants. If you are in the neighborhood for an appointment at Kleinfeld (as I was for my wedding dress), it is only a few blocks walk. Overall, its pricey for the size, but definately clean and comfortable enough for the amount of time you would actually spend in a hotel room while seeing NYC. Definately quieter than hotels nearer to tourist locations. Staff is average. They will store your bag for you before/after you check out for no additional cost but charge you some dumb $2/night fee for some arbitrary safety something or another.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but can be much better”
Reviews.Author: OnurWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two nights. Pro's: Location is perfect IF your main destinations in NYC range from mid-town to lower Manhattan, or the Chelsea area. The room we stayed in was very quiet and we got a good night's sleep. The hotel also has a (small) gym if you want to get in a quick workout. The staff is kind and polite. Con's: Room is too small, the window almost does not exist (you can't tell if there its sunshine or rain outside) and the sheets and towels are very, very old. In addition to the small size of the rooms, the design is also very un-practical. You can tell that they haven't paid attention to small details in the rooms, i.e. there are no hooks to hang anything in the batroom, or the closet is small and half of the closet is taken up by a safe, so you can't hang jackets or coats. These things become very important in small spaces, and a hotel in NYC should definitely think about these. So, if you get a good deal in the price, will spend very little time in the room and are not looking for any special amenities, then go for it. Otherwise this hotel can be annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & nice rooms, but expensive and small”
Reviews.Author: mfujio
Reviews.Content: Just a note - I'm a student at Cornell's Hotel School so I'm pretty picky about hotels that I stay in! I stayed here with my boyfriend for one night and we booked the hotel the day of our stay, so we paid about $375 including taxes (we booked directly with the hotel). Pretty steep, but understandable considering our last-minute decision and just the general high prices of NYC hotels. The hotel and rooms are very chic, modern, and minimalistic. Rooms were very small, but clean and well-kept, and I was expecting a small room given the standard in NYC. I loved the eco features in the bathroom, such as a dual-flush toilet and bulk shampoo/body wash dispensers. They did a good job in making the dispensers not look cheap. I was disappointed that they didn't have hair conditioner, though. Only one bath robe was included. The bed was comfortable and the TV was a large flat screen. We didn't hear too much outside noise, which was good because the front desk said the hotel was sold out. We had a pretty good view of the street which was great because my boyfriend and I love to people watch! I didn't have my computer with me but I think they offered free Wi-Fi, and computer/internet access was available in the basement. Overall service was above average, this isn't a luxury hotel so it was lightly staffed, but they were helpful and responsive when we needed assistance. Oh and there's only one small elevator so both guests and staff use it, but it wasn't a big deal for us at all.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny and Terrible”
Reviews.Author: VJHMV
Reviews.Content: We travel to New York frequently and usually stay at the Soho Grand, but decided to try another area of town for a change.....big mistake. The price( $289 )was a factor but then I noticed that was only for Wednesday night,on Thursday it jumped to $349. We drove down to the city and there is no doorman or bellman to help with bags or directions to nearby parking, however when the desk clerk finally got off the phone he did direct my husband to a garage that charged us $80 for a day and a half.... So, that said we dragged our bags up in the elevator to the 5th floor and entered our closet, oh, I mean room. Clean, but so small that my Lands End duffle bag took up all the floor space and we had to shimmy sideways to open the door to get out ! Calling down to the front desk we were told we could look at a handicapped room that was a bit larger, but it was so dark we decided to stick with the closet/room, at least it had a window. I was really looking forward to sleeping in but was awakened at 7am by an earsplitting alarm sounding.... when we left for the day we noticed that the elevator was broken and the stairwells were flooded. We were informed that the the sprinkler system had evidently gone off and that the elevator was out of service for the rest of our stay, not great news for us on the 5th floor and with me just having had knee surgery! Also, it was cold the first night and when I called down to the desk to ask for extra blankets,I was told that he was alone down there and couldn't provide them. When we checked out, my husband asked to speak with the manager to ask about perhaps receiving some sort of partial refund, he did get back to us several days later indicating that he was going to do so, but since then we have never heard another word!

Reviews.Title: “don't bother”
Reviews.Author: alsyd
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the chelsea are tiny - it's a disgrace that they charge what they do and hold the place up to being a 'luxury boutique' hotel. Nowhere on the site is any comment about the size of the rooms.. I was shocked to not be able to wheel my case past the bed, the wardrobe is tiny, the bathroom was poorly kept and the overall feel was dour - punctuated by poor natural light. The place doesn't have a restaurant, wifi is questionable, there was no introduction to the hotel, you're basically left to figure it out yourself. The service is poor and slow and they initially couldn't find my booking. When I checked out they overcharged me. Enough said.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location. Clean room, friendly...”
Reviews.Author: Liezlinnyc
Reviews.Content: Awesome location. Clean room, friendly staff, and superior amenities. Overall, great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: Carrie27
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 5 night stay at the GEM hotel Chelsea. The location was great, easy to get to all the tourist sights and great for going out in Greenwich Village or the Meatpacking District in the evenings. We arrived after a long delayed journey and were relieved to arrive at the hotel, the lobby is smart and well presented and we had a nice welcome by the man at reception who gave us maps of the city and a quick orientation. The room was small but we were expecting this and as we were planning to be out and about a lot it wasn't really a problem. It was a bit beaten up with marks on the wall and our window faced a wall but it was generally clean. Overall it was pretty good for the price we paid, we got a really good deal on Expedia but there are a couple of small things that could really help make it better. There was no welcome pack etc in the room so we had to ask what time we needed to check out and didn't know about some of the hotel facilities. There was only one robe provided even though there were 2 of us. This was mentioned when we checked in but no reason was given as to why, it didn't really matter as we didn't even use it but it was a bit odd. There was a small bottle of water provided (again only 1) which was in the room when we checked in, we drank it the night we arrived but were never given another one. Again not the end of the world but would have been nice if it had been replenished. The safe was really difficult to use, you had to pay for it and swipe your credit card to open and close it, which could take a while as you had to swipe it at exactly the right speed. None of these things were major problems but they're just small touches that could be easily fixed to make the overall experience a bit better. All in all I would stay there again for the location and the fact that it was a good price. As long as you're not expecting 5 start the GEM hotel is a good bet.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Dublin35Dublin
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in this hotel. We opted for a quiet room as we heard 8th Avenue is loud and we had the quietest room I have ever had in a city hotel. Although there was a wonderful view of a brick wall we had expected this thanks to reading prior reviews on here so that wasn't a problem. The bed was big considering I was sharing with my mum, but then we are two small ladies, I wouldn't have known she was there! The bathroom is small but clean and functional, we both agreed the mirror in there wasn't very flattering! They have a useful business centre with two computers which we used to look up varioius sites and a great ice machine which came in handy as the room was warm and we aren't fans of air con which worked too well! We found a brilliant deli over the road next to the Chelsea Hotel on the last day and it's only a 10min walk to Greenwich village. There are lots of bars and restaurants within 1 min walk too. Overall I would say this is a great hotel and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: salmonavacado
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here on business twice, and would recommend the hotel to young professionals who are looking for a good place to stay while working, but also a nice place to check out NYC in the evening times. The hotel is located in Chelsea really close to the E or F subway line. So, you can easily commute in a matter of minutes to your business meetings in midtown in the morning, but enjoy your evenings in a much better, younger neighborhood. There is no breakfast - but your room has a coffee pot with good coffee curtesy of the hotel, and breakfast can easily be bought at the deli across the street for less than $5. THere are also two computers in the basement with a printer, which is convinient for getting work done (again,nothing fancy but great for the young pro) and free wireless in the room - which are small but clean, and its all you need. Some are a bit noisy, but its NYC. Loved their bath products.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem worth Collecting”
Reviews.Author: brenord
Reviews.Content: Very friendly hotel in a suburb very near the underground. The area had plenty going on but not in a noisy sense. Typical small room but large enough for 2 of us. Bed & shower & TV great. Would have loved a fridge but ice available. Free internet too. Staff interested in you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Good Price”
Reviews.Author: gabopr
Reviews.Content: Even though the rooms are small, the hotel's location is amazing. The hotel itself is very elegant, clean and the staff is nice.

Reviews.Title: “The worst in it's class!”
Reviews.Author: Ariel025
Reviews.Content: I stay in NY approximately 45 nights a year and have stayed in the Hilton, Sheraton, Wyndham and a few other hotels - they all cost about the same as the GEM but provide a much much better deal all around - below is a part of the email I sent to the hotel management to which I got a template response from Choice (the hotel chain) and, as expected, no response from the hotel 1 - it's the smallest room I had in NY at this price range - not sure what they can do about this but it is what it is 2 - no bathtub - I would not have taken a room if I knew this - would have been decent to mention it on the site (the W hotel for example mentions when a room doesn't have a bathtub) 3 - they have no real work desk - the chair they provide has no back support - itâ€™s a dinning chair 4 - the desk that they do have was shabby and the Formica was completely chipped off - looks like something you find in a yard sale ( room 516 ) 5 - the safe wasn't connected to the closet - you can simply take the whole safe and walk away if you want to 6 - the instructions on the safe are incorrect and I had to call the front desk for the correct instructions to operate the safe 7 - there is no proper place to place the coffee maker - hey what can you do when the room is so smallâ€¦ 8 - the running machines at the gym have a problem with static electricity and they suddenly stopped while I was running - the same problem happened on both machines and as a semi professional athlete I have used MANY such machines and I am certain there is a problem with them 9 - the water machine at the gym was not working - I call the front desk to ask them to send me a bottle of water downstairs and was answered that "we do not have the personal to do this" - it was the middle of the day and they had no traffic at that time - if they cared at all they would have grabbed a bottle and brought it downstairs and got the house service to do this - 20 minutes after I spoke to them I accidentally saw the cleaning lady through the glass and asked her to bring me some water which she did with a smile 10 - As I was getting annoyed with the place I called the front desk from my room and asked if there is a cancellation fee if I am to check out earlier than originally booked - I was told that they will check it and get back to me in 5 minutes - 2 hours later no one got back to me and when I went out I asked him what is the answer and why he didn't get back to me and he said that there is no fee and he just got the answer - I asked him why he didnâ€™t call me after 5 minutes to let me know that it will take him more time to get an answer and he had no intelligent answer for me 11 - the radio in the room didn't work - I called the front desk and asked them to replace it - they said they will have it replaced in the morning - it wasn't done I am probably forgetting something but I think this gives you a good idea of the great time I had in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Smallest bedroom ever but great location!”
Reviews.Author: misspixels
Reviews.Content: Well, The location is perfect! Walk distance from subway, groceries, drugstore, Chelsea market...The Hotel is clean, nice, good looking but the room was the smallest bedroom I ever had in my traveller life!!!! Its was my 3rd time in NYC and I was with a friend, we ask for 2 separate bed but they dont have this setup. So these rooms are made for intimate couple not friends! But we survived! Behind that, the hotel is very clean et well decorated. The concierges are very kind. I recommend this hotel but dont pay the full price! They are much spacious rooms in NYC for this price (and with great look and location...)

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay at the GEM Hotel Cheslea”
Reviews.Author: bjrad
Reviews.Content: We checked in late on a Friday night. We had called the hotel from San Francisco and told them we were definitely on our way. We were traveling with my sister and brother-in-law and had requested 2 outside rooms on a high floor. When we got to the hotel at about 12:30 in the morning, they only had one room left. The hotel was full and most of New York City was sold out. They sent my husband and me to another hotel for the night. They checked my sister into a larger room than what she had reserved but told her they were only charging her for the room she reserved and this rate was valid for 4 nights. We finally got back to the hotel the next day and they gave us a key. We went up to the fourth floor and our room was an inside room. The window looked at a brick wall. It was claustrophobic and, frankly, unsafe if there had been a fire. We called the front desk. They sent someone upstairs with another key for a similar room across the hall that looked out on 8th avenue. After about 14 hours in New York, we finally got into the room we had requested originally. The rooms are tiny. The closets are only about two feet wide and canâ€™t even accommodate the length of a short dress or a manâ€™s shirt. There are NO drawers in the room to put clothes away. You are forced to live out of your suitcase. The air conditioning sounded like the subway was coming through our room. When we checked out the management had doubled the rate for my sisterâ€™s room because â€œThe guy at the front desk had no right to give her this room at a reduced rateâ€�. The manager was rude and totally unapologetic for everything they had put us through. There was never an apology for sending us to another hotel the first night and there was never an apology for the way they treated my sister. When we got home I wrote a letter to â€œChoice Hotelsâ€� and The GEM hotel about what happened to us. The manager of the GEM reversed the charges on my sisterâ€™s credit card. Eventually, someone from the executive offices at Choice Hotels called to see if the charges had been reversed. Choice Hotels only cared that the charges had been reversed. They didnâ€™t seem to care when I told them that we would never stay there again. There was no apology for the poor service. This hotel did something every day we were there to upset us. We are not fussy people. I worked for an airline for 17 years and I know bad customer service when I see it. I would not stay at the GEM hotel if the rooms were free.

Reviews.Title: “This GEM hotel - good location, good service”
Reviews.Author: Selleri
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this hotel. As we were sightseeing on foot this hotel has a great location for a lot of attractions on Manhattan and we will recommend this hotel if you are going with your partner. Not with children. The room was quiet small but very nice. The front desk was very helpfull and the service was great. A lot of good restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for fairly good value”
Reviews.Author: velouba
Reviews.Content: Great location with subway stations within short walking distance. All sorts of delis, restaurant, grocery shops, supermarkets, take away food in the surroundings. Close to several comedy clubs. Staff helpful when asked. Tiny room not suitable if you have a lot of luggage. Bedding of very good quality. Free wifi which is so great ! No view for most rooms (therefore fairly quiet, which becomes important after a whole day trotting along the streets...). Cleaning rather erratic, especially the bathroom however always above an average standard.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Value”
Reviews.Author: Pretty27
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome value for New York in a very central Chelsea location. The rooms are "chic minimalism" at its best with just enough of everything and very comfortable mattresses (I fell asleep within a minute of lying down every night!). The Gem Hotels are the only hotels I'll be staying in from now on....really can't get better than this for the value!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: doveydovey
Reviews.Content: After years of staying in Midtown, I attended a conference and had the opportunity to stay in the Chelsea neighborhood. The Gem was perfect. I stayed there two nights and it was close to the meatpacking district where I walked to the conference. Convenient to restaurants and shops, I also had the opportunity to take a walk on the newly constructed park/walkway. The hotel was clean, wonderful service and reasonably priced. I would stay there again, even on vacation. Chelsea is a wonderful neighborhood - I spoke with a lot of residents and met a lot of dogs! Great hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in a good neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: SarahH50
Reviews.Content: This hotel is extremely well situated and is very near (one block) to two different metro stations and several different lines, which makes travelling up or downtown easy. Loads of coffee shops, delis and restaurants within walking distance. The hotel is clean, and linen and towels changed daily if you wish. Front desk staff are courteous. There was some noise from traffic, but I would say this was not intrusive and adds to the NY atmosphere you love in this exciting town! The not-so-good news? The room is compact and the bed is very small - 4' x 6' at the most - ours was also fixed against one wall making it even more of a crush! We had difficulty securing the door to the room, but reported this to the front desk who we trust fixed it in time this for the next guests. That said, I would definitely recommend this hotel as a good one to stay in if you are in town for a short sight-seeing break and you need somewhere clean, safe neighbourhood and well situated.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and staff.”
Reviews.Author: SillyNun
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a group of friends and really enjoyed this hotel. The rooms are very small, but it's New York, who's going to spend a lot of time in the room anyway? The entire hotel is clean and nicely furnished. Our room faced the street so it was a bit noisy, but it didn't bother us. The view was great! Our friends had a room facing away from the street with a boring view but it was very quiet. The location was excellent lots of fun stuff to do within walking distance and just a five minute walk from the subway. The staff were always helpful and friendly. A special shout out to Ceasar who helped us with our taxis and lent us his own lovely umbrella when it was raining.

Reviews.Title: “Really great place”
Reviews.Author: jbeebee
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 days at the hotel with a friend. It is ideally located and the staff is evry lepful. Rooms are small but clean and nice. I recommend staying on the 5th floor in a room that does not overlook the street. 22 street is beautiful. Breakfast at Starbucks is steps away. There are really nice restaurants on 7th avenue between 22 and 21.

Reviews.Title: “Love to stay here”
Reviews.Author: larrydeb92
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the GEM hotel in Chelsea for your New York City stay. The price was right for my moderate budget, the rooms are neat and stylish, the staff is kind and helpful, and the amenities provided at no extra charge including bottled water, workout room, and wireless internet access made my stay all that much better. The location in the heart of Chelsea is perfect for convenience and fun. There are numerous restaurants, coffee shops and bakeries that I love. The area is home to many Italian, Chinese, and Mexican gourmet restaurants and the popular High Line and the Chelsea Piers waterfront parks and walking/jogging paths. This Chelsea hotel is perfect for all your business and personal visits to Manhattan. It s my choice for all my visits to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, boutique hotel in convenient location - small rooms!”
Reviews.Author: RocketAus
Reviews.Content: I was in New York for 5 days for business. I don't spend much time in my room and was by myself, so room size is not as important as things like clean room, comfortable bed and location - which this hotel has in my opinion. I must start by saying, as other reviewers have said, that the rooms are small. I was in the first room outside of the elevator on the first floor. They were booked out, so I did not have any other options. The room was clean and in good condition, the place looked reasonable new. My 1 small window looked out at a wall with little natural light, but as I was hardly in the room this did not bother me. My suitcase barely fit in the room. I had it wedged between the bed and a wall, so could only get out of the bed on the other side. The bed was comfortable as were the pillows. The bathroom was compact, but spotlessly clean. There is a good size LCD TV on the wall - with a good selection of channels - above a tiny desk. The coffee/tea maker was good, but as there is no fridge/mini bar in the room I could only used powdered milk. Location is good, as it is central as I like walking around New York. Loved the FREE WiFi. Overall I was happy with the hotel and might stay there again if I can get as good a rate (I checked all the re-seller websites and found the cheapest price on lastminute.com).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for public tranportation users”
Reviews.Author: MissTizzi
Reviews.Content: As I move mostly by public transportation in N-Y, this hotel is super conveniently located as it is one block down (3 min. walk) from the 23rd blue line subway station (which is the one that goes either to JFK or to Penn Station >Newark). Single room are small, but neat. TV flat screen is huge, however it could have additional channels. Internet access is free and work well. The room I stayed in was windowed to a wall, another hotel room window, slightly not facing mine. Sad for daylight, but great for it removes the heavy sounds of N-Y streets. It's a 3* hotel, which means it is minimum services, no food, no fridge. However, Chelsea is packed with beautiful restaurants and there's (only!) two convenient stores at the corner open almost 24h. The bed was soft and confortable. I must say that I dislike the use of polyester in linen, but it was clean. Dawn-pillows are small squared ones but comes by five. Finally very confortable. I would have only one negative remark: the ventilation in the bathroom is DEAFENING, and together with the A/C (heat) it makes quite some noise in a small room.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for those who just want a bed to sleep”
Reviews.Author: djjaguar
Reviews.Content: Ok, Ok, I read all the reviews and finally booked this hotel through a wholesaler. We arrived and checked in and were given room 509. The room is tiny but it id not bother us as we were not in NYC to stay in the room to admire the 4 walls. We could not hear any street noise as our room faced another part of the hotel. What I strongly advise management is to train the staff to be more engaging with their guests, like wishing them "hello" and "welcome", and maybe small talk. I mean it was me 90% of the time who had to wish them Happy Valentines or Have a nice day, etc.... I will not pay more than $100 per night, as we paid $120(priceline bid) at the Affinia for an excellent room with a kitchen and a full bath. Below are the pros and cons for anyone deciding to stay at this hotel: Pro's Excellent location in Chelsea a block from the subway. Very clean rooms and nice showers Con's Gym missing a Universal weights machine (underutilized gym) Tight rooms but ok for 2 small people or one person No fridge in room Loud ventilation fan in the washroom Loud room heater Bed was too small for us(it was not a queen or king but rather a double bed)

Reviews.Title: “Small but Clean Rooms, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: UpstateVisitor
Reviews.Content: Room was very small, Queen size bed, but met our needs. We knew from reading other reviews what to expect so we were not surprised. Room was very clean and the staff very helpful. Room was on the second floor so there was street noise all night long, Saturday Night stay. For the price range and location we expected this as well. Staff offered to store our luggage at no charge after checkout. Small but safe parking garage recommended by the staff worked out very well. Very convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, Horrible Hotel - DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: tjlr1891
Reviews.Content: I have never written an online review of anything, but had such a bad experience at the Gem Hotel Chelsea that I felt compelled to write one. IT WAS A TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE due to a front desk clerk with the initial "D" who was extremely rude and the worst person I have ever experienced in the hospitality industry. A highlight of problems we experienced with the hotel include, but are not limited to the following - - When my friend and I arrived the desk clerk tried to tack on extra charges to our nightly rate. - We protested and were told that we couldn't stay elsewhere due to the 48 hr cancellation policy (entrapment). - We were told the only way to avoid this fee was if we stayed in a smaller room with a full bed (I later found out this was a lie by calling the main Choice/Clarion hotels customer service and was told that we were already paying the queen bed/double occupancy rate). - The supposedly "full size bed" is one of the tiniest beds I have ever seen and is completely unsuitable for more than one person or anyone over 6 ft tall. - The hotel manager was not there so we were left without someone to resolve our problems/ we just had to have the main customer service dept file a written complaint (they have not contacted us yet and it has been over 48 hrs). - Another clerk ended up giving us a queen bed on a floor that nobody else was staying on due to water damage and large fans outside of the door, telling us that we would be charged 1/2 the normal nightly rate for that room. However, at the time of checkout we ran into the problematic desk clerk and were charged the full nightly rate for a room that was considered unsuitable for the other hotel guests. The moral is NEVER STAY AT THIS HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Small but Great”
Reviews.Author: ChachisMom
Reviews.Content: I think Motel 6 actually has larger rooms than this hotel, BUT the room was immaculately clean. The location is great and perfect for 2 people who are on the go.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD BUDGET HOTEL -- GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: SKIIERTORBAY
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Gem for 4 nights -- it's a good budget Hotel with a good location ,as everybody says -- small rooms and the sound proofing from the corridors could be better, We had a room on the 5th floor facing West , so no noise from the street. We had clean towels every day, and the room was very clean -- everything worked and the staff were friendly and attentive. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest Hotel Room I have Ever Seen!”
Reviews.Author: MarkRhodeIsland
Reviews.Content: There is little else to say. I measured my room at 9'8" by 10 ft. That's 96.5 square feet for two adults, a queen size bed, a large night stand, a desk, an armoir and 3 pieces of luggage. It was bizarre. Yes the place is clean and tidy, but the room size is so tiny, even for New York, that truth in advertising dictates that they should disclose this information clearly on the web site. It was claustrophobically suffocating and left me feeling ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Not happy”
Reviews.Author: stutravel
Reviews.Content: we booked into the Gem for three nights but on arrival we were stunned by the size of the rooms. They were the tiniest rooms we'd encountered in NY city and for the price - AUS$330 a night including taxes we thought they were expensive. The staff were friendly enough until we said we wanted to change the booking to one night so we could find something of better value and then they were pretty cold. Overall the service was pretty average. Despite the price we couldn't make a cup of tea in the room which is annoying. The location is good however. We ended up finding a bigger place of slightly better quality in Midtown near Times Square for about $60 a night less. Overall I would not recommend this place. In fairness they were quite good about releasing us from the 48 hour cancellation fee and did not charge us for the next night which they were within their rights to do. Had the rooms been a little bigger I think we'd have been happier. Being told somewhat sarcastically by the staff, "well this is New York" didn't help matters and set the tone for our stay. I'd have to say we are not nomally critical and that friendly, helpful staff can make a dingy place tolerable. They failed on this front.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, small booking issue”
Reviews.Author: mukdahan
Reviews.Content: Booked through travel republic for the gem hotel soho, when we arrived there was no rooms avalible (they had over booked). So they paid for a taxi to transfer us to the Gem hotel Chelsea and said we could stay there for the whole 4 nights if we liked. We stayed the first night then the next morning they asked why we had'nt checked out, and woke us up(got to sleep at 3am after flight delays). After saying we were not going to move they organized so we could stay the whole 4 nights. So sorted in the end. All the hotel staff were pleasent and helpful with this matter. The hotel is very new with nice rooms and bathrooms. Its also in a better location than the soho one as its closer to central manhattan. The rooms are'nt as small as everyone makes out but the bed was only a standard double, Great fixtures, fittings, big tv, toiletries etc.. .Chelsea is a great area, very safe and loads of great food around. Would definitly stay here again. The photos on the hotel website are very accurate. Thanks gem for alovely stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but keep your shoes on in the room.”
Reviews.Author: purplespud
Reviews.Content: Great location with friendly staff. You are there to spend time in NYC, not in your room. Fine. BUT... the rooms are so incredibly tiny that the 2ft strip of 'room' around 2/3 of your bed is so heavily trodden.. that if the cleaning is not superb.. you can quickly notice the filth. Bathroom was very well cleaned, great! That is to focus your attention away from the rest of the 'room'. Bedroom was full of hairs and stuff - floatsm and jetsom so to speak - when we arrived and despite daily 'cleaning'... gunks was always there. Toilet paper of the lowest grade, had to ask for an extra roll twice in 6 days. It's not a boutique hotel.. it's a red roof or super 8 pretending to be a boutique. If you are single and staying for a jam-packed weekend of NYC fun, great hotel. If you are a couple or staying for more than 2 or 3 nights.. I'd spend a bit more and try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Tucked away little gem”
Reviews.Author: SRHNYCMetro
Reviews.Content: The reception desk staff was pleasant before we arrived, during our stay and when we checked out. The "large" room with a queen bed was small, but the ideal size for a one night stay with my 5-year-old son. The room was minimally appointed with the right functional items - wall mounted flat screen TV perfectly positioned at the foot of the bed, iPod docking station/radio/alarm clock, and shampoo and shower gel dispensers in the shower. I liked the Gilcrest and Soames toiletries; bright white walls, furniture, linens and bathroom subway tiles; and lighting in the right places (over and next to the bed, at the desk and in the bathroom). The hotel is located on a residential street, just steps away from bustling 8th Avenue.
