There are many familiar shops within two blocks - Gap, Starbucks, Jamba Juice, Subway, Qdoba, Dallas BBQ, etc. And many special NYC finds - F&B Gudtfood, Spice (Thai), Murray's Bagels and many, many more. Better if's: - The dark striped carpet doesn't work at all with the bright modern decor. - The room door should open toward the desk and bathroom, not the bed. - Standard check out should be at noon, at least, instead of 11:00 a.m. - The shower drainage was slow. - We really would have appreciated having Nickelodeon. I will recommend this place to my friends, and I'll definitely consider staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Gem was great and Cesar was awesome”
Reviews.Author: stevebos2n
Reviews.Content: I almost hate to say how great the Gem Hotel in Chelsea is because my selfish side would prefer to keep it a secret. It's a very afforadable alternative to the big chain hotels in mid town which can cost literally hundreds more. The Gem is sort of funky and artsy with small European style rooms. I'ts very clean and quiet and the staff is great. Very friendly and helpful, especially Cesar, who is very polite and helpful and can help steer you to local attractions/restaurants. Cesar also speaks Portugese and Spanish in addition to English. I really like this place and it's very convenient for me. As long as you are ok with small roooms at a great price this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cool chelsea base”
Reviews.Author: mrchunky
Reviews.Content: Great value hotel in a great location. Rooms are no frills but have some nice touches in the form of the guest products and their layouts. Front desk service was efficient and they coped well with a busy weekend - helpful in providing advice on things to do locally. Business center with computer access and a gym were bonuses.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I wanted”
Reviews.Author: LavenderLawn
Reviews.Content: Rooms were air-conditioned and as neat as a pin. They were not large and were decorated in 'Ikea' style, but made good use of light and the layout was as such not to feel cramped at all, so as a solo traveller, the standard rooms were ideal. Staff were friendly, helpful, and totally lacking in snobby attitude. Water and replacement coffee were provided each evening. It is in a great location, a block from the subway and crosstown buses, and a short walk to Chelsea's galleries, bookstores and restaurants. I'd return in a second!

Reviews.Title: “It is a 'gem' if you don't have a room facing 8th Avenue”
Reviews.Author: product-of-canada
Reviews.Content: Positives: * This place just opened last year, and still feels new. The decor in the lobby and rooms are nice, and give it a botique feel. * They were able to store our luggage on our first and last day, before and after check-out. * The location is great - on 8th Ave., middle-ground between Mid-town and Lower Manhattan. * Front desk staff were nice and accommodating. * Small-scale hotel that never felt crowded - the lobby was never busy, nor was the hallway. * The free wireless internet was very handy, easy to use, and faster than our home internet service provider. * There is a computer terminal with internet, ice machine, and work-out room in the basement. * The air conditioner worked very well. * Bottled water in the rooms was a nice bonus, as was the large, wall-mounted flat-screen TV with plenty of channels. * There is a Starbucks steps from the hotel, and a subway stop very close by. * There are some great, inexpensive (by New York City standards) restaurants in this area (Chelsea), including Thai and Vietnamese restaurants. Negatives: * Our room was very small. I asked for an upgrade since we were booked for 5 nights. They suggested that I could do so after the weekend, without charge. But we adjusted to the room and never bothered. However, it would be difficult to maneuver in the smaller rooms for anyone with two large pieces of luggage. * When we checked into the first room we were assigned to, the street noise was so loud we thought the windows were opened (they were not). I was able to get a room re-assignment, although initially the front desk staff was not going to do this for me. I was reminded that I should state my preference before checking into a room. Since I doubt anyone 'wants' a loud room, the hotel should improve sound insulation on the street side. But it's more convenient for the hotel to place the onus on the customer to 'request' a quiet room. I paid for this stay months beforehand, and we stayed for 6 days - I would have expected a better room assignment based on this. Staff should really look at these factors.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Heka_BR
Reviews.Content: I have been there just some couples of weeks after it was open, during Christmas. Front desk staff was really helpfull. The location of the hotel was great, close to subway and restaurants. The room was small, but well organized, wiht a nice LCD TV, coffemaker, clean bathroom and good hot water.

Reviews.Title: “Tight Space”
Reviews.Author: chowfromNYC
Reviews.Content: My parents were visiting New York from out town and being that I lived in the East Village in a shoe box of an apt - we went online to get a hotel. We found a room for $139 in a new boutique hotel in Chelsea. The photos looked fabulous - almost too good to be true. So we called the number listed on the website, inquiring about it. My mother asked about the room layout, as I usually end up bunking with them and she wanted to make sure there was a sofa/room for a roll away. They told us the room came with a sofa sleeper - and just to ease my mom's mind, they told her they'd put a request in for a roll away bed, too. (He also mentioned a mini kitchen with microwave). My mom was satisfied; hung up the phone, then booked online through one of those big travel discount sites. We arrive - confirm the arrangements with the front desk. The staffer looked perplexed and said that the sofa/roll away would be impossible, as the rooms barely fit double beds. He walked us through the hotel and showed us 10 rooms to prove it. He apologized, and told us that we were more than likely given false information so we would book the room. He continued, saying that discount travel websites are so competitive with one another, they say anything to get you to book. This experience was a great disappointment and I no longer trust booking accommodations through the Internet.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Respite”
Reviews.Author: markroy53
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at the Gem Hotel on 22nd street from June 1 through the 4th. it is ideally located in the heart of Chelsea in Manhattan and close to all public transportation, great restaurants and whatever one wants to do in the city. The hotel staff is pleasant, and the rooms although small, are very clean and attractive. A fantastic shower. They provide free water, coffee, internet access. My only suggestion is that they include a few local tv stations on their cable network. Being an ex-newyorker, it is always nice to catch up on local news a bit when visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: sir_gomez
Reviews.Content: The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I am a Hilton Honor Platinum Member because of all the travel I do for pleasure or business. Since the Hilton in Manhattan was booked, my travel agent decided I would enjoy this hotel. He was right. My fiancÃ© and I were taken away by how clean and welcoming the lobby was. Keith, the front desk staff, was extremely friendly and went out of his way to accommodate to us. Tracy the front desk manager was also very approachable and took care of our needs. The Gem Hotel in Chelsea got my two thumbs up approval. We are already planning our next visit to NYC and the Gem Hotel is the only hotel we want to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Our New Favorite NYC Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: BusyLady231
Reviews.Content: I come to NYC very often for business and am pretty loyal to my normal hotel; but when they weren't able accept my reservation I decided to give the GEM a try. Not only did I try it but 4 of my colleagues also were there. The lobby was beautiful and being an art fan, I noticed they sold local peices from artists in the neighborhood. I thought that was a great way to incorporate a true New York hotel experience. All of us absolutely loved our rooms; the beds are so comfortable! The whole hotel was beautifully decorated and in a charming neighborhood. It felt like my new apartment in Manhattan! We will be back again and cannot wait for our next trip!! Thank you everyone at the hotel for the great experience and all your help!

Reviews.Title: “fashion hotel , perfect location, too small rooms”
Reviews.Author: milanox77
Reviews.Content: i've been there 2 nights, really nice the location and the hotel, service good, the only problem were the ize of the room, really small but in new york is quite normal...

Reviews.Title: “Better Than I Expected - I would definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: wellermdfan
Reviews.Content: I had read all the reviews so I was expecting a small room. What I wasn't expecting was a real intimate experience. The front desk staff were nice, pleasant and let me check in early. They explained all the amenities. I don't really have any complaints. If I could get the same rate, I would stay here all the time. The Best Things: My room was really clean. The bathroom was really clean. There was no mold or grout stains. Everything seemed new and clean. The shower didn't leak all over the floor. Really good soaps, shampoos, lotions. Subway stop was one block away. Lots of bars and restaurants in the neighborhood. Hairdryer in the room. Cool toilet! Comfortable Bed. Powerful air conditioner in the room. Free bottled water (2) in the room. It never seemed crowded like the bigger hotels - the lobby wasn't out of control with people and it made the whole experience seem quiet and intimate. The Worst Things (but not bad): There was about 18-20 inches from the sides of the bed to the wall and there really wasn't much room for luggage. I would imagine if you were staying for a week and had a large suitcase, it would really be inconvenient because there's not enough room to unpack things, store things or store luggage. I was only there for the weekend and only had a small pack. Bathroom door was a pocket door and it was really hard to get it to pull all the way shut. Walls were a little thin and could hear doors opening and closing. Overall I was so pleasantly surprised. I wasn't sure what to expect and was really happy with our choice to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish budget option in Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: jayschro12
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Gem Chelsea had some highs and lows that balance out to be an average rating. The hotel is in a great neighborhood and as far as I can tell there are no rooms that face busy 8th Ave, just a quiet neighborhood street, or probably an alley on the other side of the hall. The entire hotel is very compact but tastefully decorated. There is even a small gym in the basement. The room is very small, as other reviewers have mentioned. Imagine a walk in closet large enough for a bed with a small bathroom off the foot of the bed. Every inch in the room was efficiently utilized, think "IKEA hotel". We even had to get creative and stack our suitcases on top of the cabinet. The size of the room didn't bother me so much since I've stayed in tight spaces before. The downside of the hotel was the hallway noise. Due to the small size of the rooms, the bed is only a few feet from the hallway and you can clearly hear people talking on the way to their rooms, doors shutting, etc... We also had a problem two nights in a row when a fire alarm down the hall would sound and then shut off at around 5am, but to their credit they seemed very concerned and had a professional there the next day working on the system. The hotel was certainly charming and in a great location. I would recommend only for budget travelers who aren't trying to get to bed early. We paid around $160 per night, would not pay much more. Not recommended for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “The GEM is not a quite a gem”
Reviews.Author: patphx
Reviews.Content: GOOD: The price for NYC is fantastic. The hotel was only 2 months old in Jan 2009 when my wife and I visited. The room, lobby and hallways looked new. Heating and bathroom worked well. Good hot shower, bathrobes provided. Cable tv with Showtime channel. Friendly desk staff, with helpful suggestions for what to do in the Chelsea neighborhood. NOT GOOD: We paid for the larger of the 2 sizes of rooms and it was still quite small. From the wall chart, it looks like each of the 4 floors has 10 large rooms and 8 small rooms. Queen bed, and only a small desk with plastic chair, one night stand, and a small standing closet too short to hang pants or larger coats without dragging. 2 small shelves in the bottom of the closet. No place to put your suitcases. No helpful information in the room (NYC guides or tv channel lineup). You have to ask the desk for everything. On checkout the hotel added a $1 a day charge labeled simply â€œcharityâ€�. When I asked what this was, I was told simply â€œfor the kids.â€� I insisted the hotel remove the charge, which they did. A business traveler would have some explaining to do when submitting his receipts, so this tells me the hotel is not catering to business people. The hotel arranged a morning car service for $70 plus tip to Newark airport. This was only $4 more than the taxi charge coming in, so it seemed like a fair deal. When we got to Newark, we were told the charge was $80 plus tip. Probably not the hotelâ€™s fault, but they should deal with more reputable services. RECOMMENDATION: a good hotel for an independent solo traveler who is willing to ask for and then double-check everything.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review: Terrible Climate Control, Great Bed”
Reviews.Author: eruadh
Reviews.Content: The climate control was just awful. My room was absolutely freezing; it seemed as if the windows weren't properly sealed. However, using the electric baseboard heater made the room overheated and dry. There was no way to make the temperature comfortable. On the other hand, the bed was amazingly comfortable; pillows were great and the bathrobes were plush. The shower and toiletries were delightful. The room was small, but how much time do you spend there? Location is very convenient (away from the Midtown tourist areas) but best for people familiar with the subway system or willing to use the map.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend In New York”
Reviews.Author: megcrnll
Reviews.Content: I just recently spent a long weekend with some friends in NYC. I was playing around on line one night and found great deals at this website www.newyorkguest.com I was able to get the hotel for about half of what I was seeing on other sites, and great tickets to Wicked!! The hotel was really cute - has a really boutique-y/NYC feel to it. The front desk staff was really great - and the room even had an ihome in it! While we were there we got dinner at this amazing steakhouse on the east side, called Benjamin's. Overall a really great weekend in the city :)

HotelInfo.Name: GEM Hotel - Chelsea, an Ascend Collection hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 300 W 22nd St, New York City, NY 10011 (Formerly Clarion)
